attributes.action: replace the car scrappage scheme with an environmentally-friendlier grant for bicycles
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The government's car scrappage scheme is being described as green because it will destroy older vehicles, but many 10-year-old cars have plenty of life left in them; from a climate perspective, to send them to the scrap heap is money poured down the drain. This petition proposes replacing it with a ‘pounds-for-pedals’ scheme to give cyclists £100 to spend on a new bicycle, but in contrast to the car scrappage grant the traded-in bike would not be destroyed but shipped to the developing world to be re-furbished and re-used.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "replace the car scrappage scheme with an environmentally-friendlier grant for bicycles."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
